page.title: 12Epping Forest:Hawk Wood
page.content: The{Hawk Wood,}part of{Epping Forest} extends into square 3895 and is important ecologically being designated an SSSI.The wood is composed of {oak and hornbeam} secondary woodland with an understorey of holly,bramble and honeysuckle.Until 1878 many trees were{pollarded}2/3 metres above the ground,a practice which provided poles for firewood and many other uses,but left a permanent trunk or 'bolling' from which successive crops of poles would sprout at a height at which grazing cattle and deer could not reach. Since 1878 pollarding has ceased and as a result the pollards are now tall and top heavy.Shading of the ground layer by the spreading canopies results in little light reaching the forest floor and consequently the ground flora is relatively sparse.
